urn:contentItem:3SP8-7BF0-000P-N1BN-00000-00World News Briefs;Congolese Plans to Serve Without Prime Minister1997-05-23T00:00:00Z2020-08-04T18:50:44ZLexisNexisSection A; Section A; Page 5; Column 1; Foreign Desk Column 1; Foreign Desk World News Briefs;
Congolese Plans to Serve Without Prime MinisterReuters KINSHASA, Congo, Friday, May 23

Laurent Kabila, who has proclaimed himself President of the former Zaire, will not appoint a prime minister, one of his chief lieutenants said today.

"There will be no prime minister," the aide, Gaetan Kakudji, said at a news conference just after midnight. "It is a presidential regime." Mr. Kabila and his rebel troops, the Alliance of Democratic Forces, ousted President Mobutu Sese Seko on Saturday.

Just before midnight on Thursday, the state radio broadcast a list of 13 ministers in a transitional Government.

There was no mention of a prime minister, the post which Mr. Kabila was under pressure to give to Etienne Tshisekedi, a longtime opponent of Mr. Mobutu.
